equipment.name: GenericArmor
equipment.description:
A mysterious, perfectly crafted piece of armor. You can't work out what it's made from, and the armor is so smooth it's almost frictionless.

This probably shouldn't exist.

equipment.name: GreenArmor
equipment.description: Standard issue armor amongst [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] Marines. It won't save you from a [RED]fireblast[END], but [GRAY]bullets[END] won't be much of an issue, at least from basic infantry weaponry.

equipment.name: BlueArmor
equipment.description: Heavy and tough armor for [DARKGREEN]UAC[END]'s assault troops. This armor resists [BLUE]plasma[END], the kind of firepower a real enemy would be packing.

equipment.name: RedArmor
equipment.description: The armor of the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END]'s elite commandos, this armor has amazing protective ability, and is quite resistant to [RED]fire[END] attacks.

equipment.name: TowerShieldArmor
equipment.description: An ancient medieval tower shield, this relic of ancient warfare can completely block the most vicious of attacks. Unfortunately, it can't withstand such damage for a long time.

equipment.name: TacticalArmor
equipment.description: Advanced armor given to [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] operatives that excel at avoiding danger, this armor contains advanced ECM systems that jam any kind of tracking systems. Tactical armor comes standard with a basic nanobot repair module.

equipment.name: BallisticGreenArmor
equipment.description:
Ballistic armor is great for battling former humans, but be careful, it's quite easily ignited by [RED]fire[END] attacks.
 The [GREEN]Security[END] variant retains has considerable [GREEN]bullet[END] resistance.

equipment.name: BallisticBlueArmor
equipment.description:
Ballistic armor is great for battling former humans, but be careful, it's quite easily ignited by [RED]fire[END] attacks.
 The [BLUE]Combat[END] variant retains it's [BLUE]plasma[END] resistance, making it a bit more useful in general.

equipment.name: BallisticRedArmor
equipment.description:
Ballistic armor is great for battling former humans, but be careful, it's quite easily ignited by [RED]fire[END] attacks.
 The [RED]Commando[END] variant almost nullifies it's [RED]fire[END] weakness, making it a more desirable armor to wear in battle.

equipment.name: FireproofGreenArmor
equipment.description:
A full body covering suit made out of nonflammable materials, this suit provides adequate protection from both [RED]fire[END] and [GREEN]bullet[END] attacks.
 However, the suit can be easily torn by [YELLOW]melee[END] attacks, so keep your distance from the enemy.

equipment.name: FireproofBlueArmor
equipment.description:
A full body covering suit made out of nonflammable materials, this suit provides adequate protection from both [RED]fire[END] and [BLUE]plasma[END] attacks.
 However, the suit can be easily torn by [YELLOW]melee[END] attacks, so keep your distance from the enemy.

equipment.name: FireproofRedArmor
equipment.description:
A full body covering suit made out of nonflammable materials, this suit provides excellent protection from [RED]fire[END]-based attacks.
 However, the suit can be easily torn by [YELLOW]melee[END] attacks, so keep your distance from the enemy.

equipment.name: NanofiberGreenArmor
equipment.description:
An armor type designed for use in corrosive enviroments, this armor sacrifices protection for extreme durability and resistance to acidic or corrosive effects.
 The [GREEN]Security[END] variant gives a bare minimum of [GREEN]bullet[END] resist, but will probably outlast you by several thousand years.

equipment.name: NanofiberBlueArmor
equipment.description:
An armor type designed for use in corrosive enviroments, this armor sacrifices protection for extreme durability and resistance to acidic or corrosive effects.
 The [BLUE]Combat[END] variant gives a bare minimum of [BLUE]plasma[END] resist, but will probably outlast you by several thousand years.

equipment.name: NanofiberRedArmor
equipment.description:
An armor type designed for use in corrosive enviroments, this armor sacrifices protection for extreme durability and resistance to acidic or corrosive effects.
 The [RED]Commando[END] variant gives a bare minimum of [RED]fire[END] resist, but will probably outlast you by several thousand years.

equipment.name: PowerGreenArmor
equipment.description:
A set of armor filled with equipment designed to amplify it's natural resistance to damage. Power armor also comes with an advanced nanobot repair module, making this a great choice for a lone marine on a dangerous mission.
 The [GREEN]Security[END] variant has double [GREEN]bullet[END] resistance.

equipment.name: PowerBlueArmor
equipment.description:
A set of armor filled with equipment designed to amplify it's natural resistance to damage. Power armor also comes with an advanced nanobot repair module, making this a great choice for a lone marine on a dangerous mission.
 The [BLUE]Combat[END] variant has double [BLUE]plasma[END] resistance.

equipment.name: PowerRedArmor
equipment.description:
A set of armor filled with equipment designed to amplify it's natural resistance to damage. Power armor also comes with an advanced nanobot repair module, making this a great choice for a lone marine on a dangerous mission.
 The [RED]Commando[END] variant has double [RED]fire[END] resistance.

equipment.name: FireshieldArmor
equipment.description: A shield system protected by a tough set of armor, this is designed to shrug off [RED]fire[END] damage without issue, as well as protect against other damage types with a tough heat-resistant alloy.

equipment.name: AblativeGreenArmor
equipment.description: An armor incorporating ablative armor layers in an effort to improve armor effectiveness without a substantial increase in cost. The [GREEN]Security[END] variant completely prevents [GREEN]bullet[END] damage breaking through the armor's [GOLD]Protection[END].

equipment.name: AblativeBlueArmor
equipment.description: An armor incorporating ablative armor layers in an effort to improve armor effectiveness without a substantial increase in cost. The [BLUE]Combat[END] variant completely prevents [BLUE]plasma[END] damage breaking through the armor's [GOLD]Protection[END].

equipment.name: AblativeRedArmor
equipment.description: An armor incorporating ablative armor layers in an effort to improve armor effectiveness without a substantial increase in cost. The [RED]Commando[END] variant completely prevents [RED]fire[END] damage breaking through the armor's [GOLD]Protection[END].

equipment.name: NanofiberSkinGreenArmor
equipment.description:
A body covering suit made from the same nanofiber technology used in other armors, this suit offers resistance to all damage types. However, the suit has to conform to your body, and cannot be removed without specific equipment.
 The [GREEN]Security[END] variant provides additional [GREEN]bullet[END] resistance.

equipment.name: NanofiberSkinBlueArmor
equipment.description:
A body covering suit made from the same nanofiber technology used in other armors, this suit offers resistance to all damage types. However, the suit has to conform to your body, and cannot be removed without specific equipment.
 The [BLUE]Combat[END] variant provides additional [BLUE]plasma[END] resistance.

equipment.name: NanofiberSkinRedArmor
equipment.description:
A body covering suit made from the same nanofiber technology used in other armors, this suit offers resistance to all damage types. However, the suit has to conform to your body, and cannot be removed without specific equipment.
 The [RED]Commando[END] variant provides additional [RED]fire[END] resistance.

equipment.name: CerberusArmor
equipment.description: An experimental armor still in the prototype stage, this armor has a dynamic power field that flows across its surface, reducing and deflecting damage without encumbering the user with heavy, bulky plating.

equipment.name: CybernanoGreenArmor
equipment.description:
One of the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END]'s greatest advancements in infantry armor technology, this wonder of modern science will absorb huge amounts of damage without much problem. Unfortunately, the armor is extremely complex, and [DARKRED]cannot be removed without assistance.[END]
 The [GREEN]Security[END] variant deflects [GREEN]bullets[END] quite efficiently.

equipment.name: CybernanoBlueArmor
equipment.description:
One of the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END]'s greatest advancements in infantry armor technology, this wonder of modern science will absorb huge amounts of damage without much problem. Unfortunately, the armor is extremely complex, and [DARKRED]cannot be removed without assistance.[END]
 The [BLUE]Combat[END] variant deflects [BLUE]plasma[END] quite efficiently.

equipment.name: CybernanoRedArmor
equipment.description:
One of the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END]'s greatest advancements in infantry armor technology, this wonder of modern science will absorb huge amounts of damage without much problem. Unfortunately, the armor is extremely complex, and [DARKRED]cannot be removed without assistance.[END]
 The [RED]Commando[END] variant deflects [RED]fire[END] quite efficiently.

equipment.name: BallisticShieldArmor
equipment.description: A [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] energy shield set up to deflect [GREEN]bullets[END] and other kinds of [YELLOW]physical[END] impacts. Because of the way they work, if it tries to deflect an attack of a different type from what it normally should, the shield will short out and take damage. Shields are too complicated to repair normally.

equipment.name: BallisticVestArmor
equipment.description: A tough armor for fighting against a storm of [GREEN]bullets[END] and surviving, the ballistic vest reduces [GREEN]bullet[END] and [YELLOW]physical[END] damage by half.

equipment.name: BulletproofVestArmor
equipment.description: The toughest non-shield for defending against [GREEN]bullets[END]. The bullet-proof vest will save your hide when you're up against a bunch of formers packing chainguns.

equipment.name: CyberwarriorArmor
equipment.description: A strange armor with a mixture of futuristic and old Asian design. This armor interfaces with it's wearer and assists their muscle movements, causing their techniques with bladed weapons to improve drastically. Due to the interface, removing the armor by yourself is not recommended.

equipment.name: DuelistArmor
equipment.description: A strange, old looking suit, surprisingly in good condition still. Beneath the outer layer of the outfit lie some armor plates for deflecting [GREEN]bullets[END].

equipment.name: EnergyShieldedVestArmor
equipment.description: A combination of a small armor vest and a low-power energy shield. The shield reduces energy damage by half, and the vest also protects the user from harm.

equipment.name: EnergyShieldArmor
equipment.description: A [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] energy shield set up to resist [BLUE]plasma[END], [RED]fire[END] and other types of energy attacks. Because of the way they work, if it tries to deflect an attack of a different type from what it normally should, the shield will short out and take damage. Shields are too complicated to repair normally.

equipment.name: GothicArmor
equipment.description: Ancient medieval plate armor, heavy as hell and just as protective as it looks. While it might not be terribly easy to move in, you can't dismiss it's defensive power. A downside of this armor is that it degrades quickly under continuous assault.

equipment.name: MedicalArmor
equipment.description: An armor co-designed by both the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] and [DARKBLUE]Serygenix[END], this armor [PINK]heals[END] the user when they are critically wounded, and can also increase the potency of various medical supplies. The armor is quite tough as well, helping to keep field medics alive in battle.

equipment.name: PhaseshiftArmor
equipment.description: An experiment in making a suit that would allow marines to walk through walls to ambush the invading demons. The suit was never able to move the user through walls, but it could put them out of phase with all manner of smaller solid objects, allowing the user to pass through projectiles.

equipment.name: PlasmashieldArmor
equipment.description: A [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] energy shield set up to resist [BLUE]plasma[END]-based projectiles or plasma explosions. Because of the way they work, if it tries to deflect an attack of a different type from what it normally should, the shield will short out and take damage. Shields are too complicated to repair normally.

equipment.name: RepulsionWaveSuitArmor
equipment.description: A shield system that has been redesigned to power a small repulsor field system. The wearer can activate it when fully charged to blast away any nearby objects, giving you some precious breathing room.

equipment.name: SurvivalMediArmor
equipment.description: A specialty armor designed by [DARKBLUE]Serygenix[END], it monitors the life signs of the wearer. If the wearer is injured, the armor releases various chemicals into their bloodstream, helping to preserve their life. It also enhances [PINK]health[END] items.

equipment.name: OverchargeSystemArmor
equipment.description: A bulky device worn on the arm, the Overcharge System can be wired directly into most [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] energy weapons, giving them a temporary boost to their damage output. The device recharges slowly, so picking the right time to overcharge your weapons is critical.
attributes: [DARKGREEN]Multiplies plasma damage for a brief time[END]

equipment.name: OnyxArmor
equipment.description: A strange armor that is almost completely [DARKGRAY]indestructible[END]. While it doesn't protect the user that well, it won't break from even the heaviest attacks.

equipment.name: NuclearArmor
equipment.description: An experimental armor powered by a compact nuclear generator, this armor's primary purpose is to enhance the power generation of nuclear-powered weaponry. The armor has heavy protection around the reactor, but little armor thickness remains to protect the wearer from harm.

equipment.name: RechargeableEnergyShieldArmor
equipment.description: An energy shield with slightly lower effectiveness, but able to be [ORANGE]recharged[END] with standard [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] energy cells. This allows the shield to continue to function for extended periods of time without needing to have specialists repair it.

equipment.name: BerserkerArmor
equipment.description: A dark and heavy set of armor that seems to amplify your anger. All you want to do is crush all the monsters you can see, and keep killing them until there's nothing left but blood and mangled bodies.

equipment.name: BerserkPowersuitArmor
equipment.description: A somewhat sinister creation, this armor can store berserk stimulants and inject the user with them at any time, allowing a marine to change from a half dead wreck to a one-man killing machine in the blink of an eye. The origin of this armor is unknown, but likely disturbing.

equipment.name: BlazingPhoenixDeviceSuitArmor
equipment.description: A recall device, coupled with a powerful [BLUE]plasma[END] discharge weapon. Activating the device causes it to charge up for a short time, before releasing a colossal [BLUE]plasma[END] explosion and [GREEN]teleporting[END] the wearer out of harms way. Make sure you have the cells to charge it though.

equipment.name: CyberneticArmor
equipment.description: A suit of armor that directly interfaces and combines with the wearer [DARKRED]permanently.[END] The resistance this armor provides is nothing short of incredible, but it can never be removed without killing the wearer. While some people are adverse to the idea of permanently becoming a living cybernetic weapon, sometimes it's the only way you're gonna survive the mess ahead of you. Make a choice.

equipment.name: EnergyDischargeHarnessArmor
equipment.description: A counterattack system designed to be used on unmanned drones and robots, this device absorbs part of any energy attacks that hit it. Activating this device unleashes all the collected energy into a single explosion with force equal to the amount of charges it contains.

equipment.name: FrontlineEngineerSuitArmor
equipment.description: A suit generally issued to [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] field engineers, this set has the tools needed to deploy automated sentry guns to assist [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] forces in the field. Multiple sentry models exist with a wide array of weapons, so a user can often deploy sentries that suit them the most.

equipment.name: GeosGoldenGauntletArmor
equipment.description:
A magical gauntlet made from pure gold. While it offers you almost no protection, it does seem to boost your confidence quite a bit. For some reason, you feel like you could take on any foe with a single punch.
 That's silly, though.

equipment.name: JetpackArmor
equipment.description:
Designed for use in the often crazy and always hazardous terrain of Hell, this jetpack will help you get anywhere you need to, and in style!

 (Also breaks levels, don't blame me if you fall out the entire level or something.)

equipment.name: JetpackArmor
equipment.description:
Designed for use in the often crazy and always hazardous terrain of Hell, this jetpack will help you get anywhere you need to, and in style!

 (Also breaks levels, don't blame me if you fall out the entire level or something.)

equipment.name: KateMatterstormHarnessArmor
equipment.description: The product of an experiment in controlled prismatic [BLUE]plasma[END], this armor can unleash a storm of bouncing blasts from the prismatic arrays across the armor's surface. While bizarre in appearance, its power cannot be questioned; in a closed space, it'll rip enemies apart. There's also a cute little heart on the side.

equipment.name: KyleTeslaboltArmor
equipment.description: A mysterious armor armed with advanced lightning generators. The tesla coils are capable of electrocuting enemies at quite a long range, and can destroy most enemies with ease. The internal generators have a long charge time, so pick your targets wisely.

equipment.name: LavaArmor
equipment.description: A mysterious piece of armor, forged in the depths of Hell. The armor appears to be made of still-liquid magma, but the armor is solid to the touch, and only warm, instead of superheated.

equipment.name: MaleksArmor
equipment.description: The heavy armor of a long-dead warrior who fought against Hell in ages past. The armor is infused with the soul of the warrior, who yearns to battle the demons once more.

equipment.name: MedicalPowerArmor
equipment.description: [DARKBLUE]]Serygenix's[END] advanced medical systems are incorporated into a set of powerarmor. This armor is far more durable than normal, preventing loss of the medical capacities from enemy attacks. The armor is also twice as resistant to damage as it's smaller, non-powered cousin.

equipment.name: NanoAblativeArmor
equipment.description: An advanced armor prototype, this armor is a combination of the excellent protective power of ablative armor, along with the self-repair capacity of an advanced nanobot repair module. Keep this armor working, and it'll keep you alive.

equipment.name: NuclearPowerArmor
equipment.description: A bulky set of powerarmor, clearly not of UAC manufacture, this armor is powered by a small microfusion reactor on it's heavily armor back. It's obvious it was designed to be used in extremely hazardous enviroments, and that'll serve you well.

equipment.name: PrototypeAssaultShieldArmor
equipment.description: A prototype shield designed to be worn by special assault marines, this shield uses up an extraordinary amount of power compared to normal shields, but provides great protection to [WHITE]all normal damage[END] types while active. It costs [BLUE]100 cells[END] to activate, and lasts for [ORANGE]5 minutes[END] before running out of power entirely.

equipment.name: RoystensCommandArmor
equipment.description:
The uniform of the commander of the Deimos research base. Wearing this decorated armor makes you feel like a hero, although the medals aren't actually yours. You've no idea why you found it here, though.

 [RED]SHENANIGANS[END]

equipment.name: RyanCordellPsychicAmplifierSuitArmor
equipment.description: The product of [DARKGREEN]UAC's[END] limited forays into the strange world of psychic power, this suit heightens the wearer's psionic potential, allowing them to attack the minds of their enemies. Its protective ability is pretty poor though.

equipment.name: ShieldedArmor
equipment.description: A perfect shield/armor combo, this armor has the power of a prototype ballistic shield, protected by a bulky set of armor, preventing the shield from being damaged. With this massive suit, you no longer fear (most) [GREEN]bullets[END]!

equipment.name: SoloOperativeSuitArmor
equipment.description: A stealth suit left behind by some unknown soldier who fell to the demons onslaught. It's very resistant to bullets, and comes with a bunch of gadgets you could use to sneak around. That is, if you were sneaking around humans, instead of bloodthirsty demons.

equipment.name: TacticalAssemblerSuitArmor
equipment.description: A suit generally issued to [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] maintenance workers, this set has the tools needed to deploy advanced restorer devices to heal [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] forces in the field. A properly qualified technician would be able to use this equipment most efficiently.

equipment.name: TerminusEst13BattlesuitArmor
equipment.description: A juggernaut of an armor, armed with 4 shoulder mounted missile launchers. In an attempt to surprise the enemy with a single volley of missiles, [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] incorporated a minor disguise into the design. Unfortunately, demons don't fall for it, but it looks cool.

equipment.name: TorgueBlastplateArmor
equipment.description: [DARKGREEN]UAC[END], in a visit to a different dimension, discovered a company with access to advanced alloys and technology. Commissioning them to craft a set of high-tech armor, they were presented with this item. The enthusiastic test by the company official resulted in some fatalities, so [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] left and did not return.

equipment.name: WildWeaselPeacekeeperArmor
equipment.description: A specialty armor designed for the commander of the Phobos garrison, a fan of westerns. While he might be dead, his armor will help you bring the law to the demons, and with a stylish hat to boot. This armor causes all Revolver-type weapons to do +50 extra damage, and have perfect accuracy.

equipment.name: XaserPowerArmor
equipment.description: A powerarmor design from the enigmatic [GOLD]Xaser Incorporated[END], the specifications of this armor are unknown. It appears to have excellent protective properties and appears to be able to interface directly with [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] plasma rifles somehow. Modified or assembled plasma rifles will likely work too.

equipment.name: ZeroDiamondAssaultforceArmor
equipment.description: Armor designed for a special branch of heavy assault troops, this armor has a minigun built into the chest, allowing the wearer to fire it while also being free to use any other weapon they want. The 0D Assaultforce motto is ''If it ain't dead, give it more lead!'' The minigun fires a burst of 50 shots, so make sure you have the ammo for it.

equipment.name: DemonicCarapaceArmor
equipment.description: Made from the flesh of demons and imbued with unholy life, this armor is quite willing to protect your life, as long as you keep killing enemies. Smells really bad though.

equipment.name: NecroArmor
equipment.description: A foul demonic armor from the silent crypts of Hell, this armor feeds of the blood of it's wearer to repair damage to itself. Luckily the armor has difficulty drinking your blood when you are close to death, so it won't kill you. The next thing you find probably will, though.

equipment.name: SoulshatterArmor
equipment.description: An unspeakable unholy armor, wearing it feels like it's slowly eating away at you. While an extremely bad idea, if you allow it to feed off your soul, it'll unleash the energy it stole in a wave that'll sap the lifeforce of all nearby enemies.

equipment.name: AngelicArmor
equipment.description:
The armor of an archangel, who fell in battle against the forces of Hell. The holy power of the armor shields you from harm. Hope heaven doesn't want it back anytime soon.
 The decoration on this armor is extremely intricate, and anytime you try to study the carvings in detail, you notice that it's even more intricate than you can fathom.

equipment.name: ChronotrooperArmor
equipment.description: A [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] armor filled with the most incredible technology ever seen. This armor can stop time for a short length of time, and considering this, it's apparent that this armor came from some point in the future. How it came to be here is a mystery. There seems to be faint writing on the back that spells out 'Za Warudo'

equipment.name: ReactiveShieldSystemArmor
equipment.description: The most advanced shield system the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] has designed, this shield adapts to any type of damage without any strain on it's systems, and provides more resistance than any other shield as well. It's only flaw is that it won't protect against damage types other than it's current one.

equipment.name: TheBeeArmor
equipment.description: A strange kind of shield, very different from [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] designed shields. This shield absorbs all kinetic and exotic energy that impacts it, and redirects the energy to enhance weaponry to an extreme level. Unfortunately, the effect works both ways, enhancing enemy attacks to devastating effect against you. If you intend on using this device, mastering the art of dodging is a must for survival. Or just killing everything before it even attacks. That works too.

equipment.name: AnnihilationSystemArmor
equipment.description: One of the most obscene power armor designs out of the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] yet, this bulky, complex suit manages to interface with [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] BFG weapons, granting them truly ridiculous firepower.

equipment.name: OModGreenArmor
equipment.description: [DARKGRAY]Onyx[END]-modded standard issue armor amongst [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] Marines. It won't save you from a fireblast, but [GREEN]bullets[END] won't be much of an issue, at least from basic infantry weaponry.

equipment.name: OModBlueArmor
equipment.description: Heavy, tough, [DARKGRAY]onyx[END]-modded armor for [DARKGREEN]UAC[END]'s assault troops. This armor resists [BLUE]plasma[END], the kind of firepower a real enemy would be packing.

equipment.name: OModRedArmor
equipment.description: The armor of the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END]'s elite commandos that's been [DARKGRAY]onyx[END]-modded, this armor has amazing protective ability, and is quite resistant to [RED]fire[END] attacks.

equipment.name: OModBallisticVestArmor
equipment.description: A tough, [DARKGRAY]onyx[END]-modded armor for fighting against a storm of bullets and surviving, the ballistic vest reduces [GREEN]bullet[END] damage by half.

equipment.name: OModBulletproofVestArmor
equipment.description: The toughest non-shield for defending against [GREEN]bullets[END]. The [DARKGRAY]onyx[END]-modded bullet-proof vest will save your hide when you're up against a bunch of formers packing chainguns.

equipment.name: OModCyberwarriorArmor
equipment.description: A strange, [DARKGRAY]onyx[END]-modded armor with a mixture of futuristic and old Asian design. This armor interfaces with its wearer and assists their muscle movements, causing their techniques with bladed weapons to improve drastically. Due to the interface, removing the armor by yourself is not recommended.

equipment.name: OModDuelistArmor
equipment.description: A strange, old-looking [DARKGRAY]onyx[MOD]-modded suit, surprisingly in good condition still. Beneath the outer layer of the outfit lie some armor plates for deflecting [GREEN]bullets[END].

equipment.name: OModEnergyShieldedVestArmor
equipment.description: A combination of a small, [DARKGRAY]onyx[END]-modded armor vest and a low-power energy shield. The shield reduces energy damage by half, and the vest also protects the user from harm.

equipment.name: OModGothicArmor
equipment.description: Ancient medieval plate armor that's been [DARKGRAY]onyx[END]-modded, heavy as hell and just as protective as it looks. While it might not be terribly easy to move in, you can't dismiss its defensive power.

equipment.name: OModMedicalArmor
equipment.description: An [DARKGRAY]onyx[END]-modded armor co-designed by both the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] and Serygenix, this armor [PINK]heals[END] the user when they are critically wounded, and can also increase the potency of various medical supplies. The armor is quite tough as well, helping to keep field medics alive in battle.

equipment.name: OModPhaseshiftArmor
equipment.description: An experiment in making a suit that would allow marines to walk through walls to ambush the invading demons. This [DARKGRAY]onyx[END]-modded suit was never able to move the user through walls, but it could put them out of phase with all manner of smaller solid objects, allowing the user to pass through projectiles.

equipment.name: OModRepulsionWaveSuitArmor
equipment.description: An [DARKGRAY]onyx[END]-modded shield system that has been redesigned to power a small repulsor field system. The wearer can activate it when fully charged to blast away any nearby objects, giving you some precious breathing room.

equipment.name: OModSurvivalMediArmor
equipment.description: A specialty, [DARKGRAY]onyx[END]-modded armor designed by [DARKBLUE]Serygenix[END], it monitors the life signs of the wearer. If the wearer is injured, the armor releases various chemicals into their bloodstream, helping to preserve their life. It also enhances [PINK]health[END] items.

equipment.name: GenericBoots
equipment.description: A terrifyingly generic pair of boots. The sheer plainness of them sends your brain reeling in shock. You aren't entirely sure how you can even walk in such things, but apparently they do have friction somehow.

equipment.name: SteelBoots
equipment.description: Standard issue boots for most [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] Space Marines. While not terribly protective, it's good to have an extra layer between your toes and whatever enviroment you're walking through.

equipment.name: ProtectiveBoots
equipment.description: Thicker and costlier than the standard-issue steel boots, the Protective Boots will do a far better job at protecting you from whatever stupid crap you just dunked yourself into.

equipment.name: PlasteelBoots
equipment.description: Expensive but awesome, plasteel-armored boots are extremely resilient to both direct damage, as well as various kinds of acid and extreme temperatures.

equipment.name: AcidproofBoots
equipment.description:
Super high-tech boots that laugh at any kind of acid. Apparently the team leader of the scientists that developed this was injured by acid in her youth, and declared war upon them, or something like that.
 The technology that shields them from acid seems to work well in other enviroments too.

equipment.name: GothicBoots
equipment.description: Giant, superheavy metal boots, the kind you'd expect some plate-armored knight to be stomping around in. It's sure going to be a heck of a workout running around in these, that's for sure.

equipment.name: PhaseshiftBoots
equipment.description:
The second set of equipment for the Phased-Assault Initiative. By producing a field of energy between the armor and boots, it can be expanded to cover an entire person, and kinda just... phase them slightly out of existance.

 It is a mystery.

equipment.name: ShockwaveBoots
equipment.description:
Originally used to cushion people from the crushing impact of a long drop, the extreme timing needed to use these effectively made them pretty useless for their intended role.
 Thanks to a frustrated test subject, scientists found that the sonic force it emits is really good at smashing things, even through the air.

equipment.name: Enviroboots
equipment.description:
Top of the line [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] hazardous enviroment boots. The amount of protective tech, backup protective fields, emergency shields, and other stuff in these boots boggles the mind.
 If you go die a horrible fate somewhere, in the future some explorer will likely find your skeleton, sticking out of a pair of perfectly functioning Enviroboots.

equipment.name: FrontlineEngineerBoots
equipment.description: Comfy little blue boots. They fill you with a strange sense of pride in machinery, and also a slight hatred of invisible frenchmen for some reason.

equipment.name: LavaBoots
equipment.description: These look like they'll burn your feet off, but are actually really warm and comfy. You'd probably love to go out on a snowy day wearing these.

equipment.name: LeonidasBoots
equipment.description:
Ancient-looking armored sandals, spattered with dried blood. A strange spiritual essence seems to permeate them, and occasionally enhance your ability to kick so hard you'll turn things inside out.

 Sounds like madness, really.

equipment.name: NuclearPowerBoots
equipment.description: High-tech super-tough armored leggings, designed to fit together with some sort of massive power armor. Interestingly, it doesn't seem like it was [DARKGREEN]UAC[END]-made.

equipment.name: NyarlaptotepsBoots
equipment.description: Strange metal boots that pulsate with strange, eldritch power. Fire seems to simply glance off them with no effects whatsoever.

equipment.name: RoystensCombatBoots
equipment.description: Fancy [DARKGREEN]UAC[END] boots, generally issued to a high-ranking military officer. I'm sure no one will mind if you wear them here.

equipment.name: SoloOperativeBoots
equipment.description: Sleek and form-fitting, made of a non-reflective black material. These boots seem like the kind of thing you'd want to use to infiltrate some secret military base or something.

equipment.name: TacticalAssemblerBoots
equipment.description: Comfy little red boots. They fill you with a strange sense of pride in machinery, and also a slight fear of wheeled bombs on rail-tracks.

equipment.name: TorgueBlastBoots
equipment.description: Big bulky boots with all sorts of fire-resistant plating and materials. The soles of the boots have some sort of explosive weapon built into them, but require a compatible powersource to use, it seems.

equipment.name: DemonicBoots
equipment.description: A disgusting pile of flesh in a crude representation of boots. If you can stomach the thought of wearing these, they might be useful in overcoming the dangers of Hell.

equipment.name: AngelicBoots
equipment.description: Radiating a faint holy light, these boots seem like the perfect thing to wear if you're going to fight Hell itself.

equipment.name: TacticalBoots
equipment.description: Lightweight and sleek, these boots have an advanced friction coating on the soles, and all kinds of pumps and gyros that help you launch yourself faster with each step you take.

equipment.name: FireproofSteelBoots
equipment.description:
Made of highly fire-resistant materials, these boots are excellent for the kinds of burning enviroments Hell might have to offer.
 These were originally Steel Boots, but have been modified to be fire-resistant.

equipment.name: FireproofProtectiveBoots
equipment.description:
Made of highly fire-resistant materials, these boots are excellent for the kinds of burning enviroments Hell might have to offer.
 These were originally Protective Boots, but have been modified to be fire-resistant.

equipment.name: FireproofPlasteelBoots
equipment.description:
Made of highly fire-resistant materials, these boots are excellent for the kinds of burning enviroments Hell might have to offer.
 These were originally Plasteel Boots, but have been modified to be fire-resistant.

equipment.name: GrapplingSteelBoots
equipment.description:
Boots equipped with a set of hooks and grapples that automatically fasten the wearer to whatever surface they're standing on, but without impeding their normal movement.
 These were originally Steel Boots, but have been modified to intelligently attach to surfaces.

equipment.name: GrapplingProtectiveBoots
equipment.description:
Boots equipped with a set of hooks and grapples that automatically fasten the wearer to whatever surface they're standing on, but without impeding their normal movement.
 These were originally Protective Boots, but have been modified to intelligently attach to surfaces.

equipment.name: GrapplingPlasteelBoots
equipment.description:
Boots equipped with a set of hooks and grapples that automatically fasten the wearer to whatever surface they're standing on, but without impeding their normal movement.
 These were originally Plasteel Boots, but have been modified to intelligently attach to surfaces.

equipment.name: EnviromentalSteelBoots
equipment.description:
Boots that have been equipped with all kinds of hazardous enviroment technology. While not as effective as the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END]'s Enviroboots, these are still some of the best footgear for going to bad places.
 These were originally Steel Boots, but have been modified to be immensely protective against hazardous enviroments.

equipment.name: EnviromentalProtectiveBoots
equipment.description:
Boots that have been equipped with all kinds of hazardous enviroment technology. While not as effective as the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END]'s Enviroboots, these are still some of the best footgear for going to bad places.
 These were originally Protective Boots, but have been modified to be immensely protective against hazardous enviroments.

equipment.name: EnviromentalPlasteelBoots
equipment.description:
Boots that have been equipped with all kinds of hazardous enviroment technology. While not as effective as the [DARKGREEN]UAC[END]'s Enviroboots, these are still some of the best footgear for going to bad places.
 These were originally Plasteel Boots, but have been modified to be immensely protective against hazardous enviroments.

equipment.name: AntigravSteelBoots
equipment.description:
Boots that have been equipped with compact anti-grav generators and tiny ion thrusters. Not strong enough to fly with on their own, but they will certainly increase the height you can jump massively.
 These were originally Steel Boots, but have been modified to be increase your jump height.

equipment.name: AntigravProtectiveBoots
equipment.description:
Boots that have been equipped with compact anti-grav generators and tiny ion thrusters. Not strong enough to fly with on their own, but they will certainly increase the height you can jump massively.
 These were originally Protective Boots, but have been modified to be increase your jump height.

equipment.name: AntigravPlasteelBoots
equipment.description:
Boots that have been equipped with compact anti-grav generators and tiny ion thrusters. Not strong enough to fly with on their own, but they will certainly increase the height you can jump massively.
 These were originally Plasteel Boots, but have been modified to be increase your jump height.

equipment.name: CerberusBoots
equipment.description: Advanced boots designed to not only laugh at lethal enviroments, but to link with the Cerberus Armor and Tristar Blaster's systems. An amazing piece of technology that'll serve you well for sure.

equipment.name: NuclearPowerArmorComplete
equipment.description: A bulky set of powerarmor, clearly not of UAC manufacture, this armor is powered by a small microfusion reactor on it's heavily armor back. It's obvious it was designed to be used in extremely hazardous enviroments, and that'll serve you well.
